sense.name: (cause to) be anxious or preoccupied
sense.commentary: Syntax includes: NP1[agent] WORRY PP{P NP[topic]} NP1[theme] WORRY (Argument for the entity worried is not present) NP1[theme] WORRY NP2[patient] NOTE: Preposition is usually 'about'
sense.examples: Mary has been worrying about her weight. There is nothing to worry about. John is paid to worry about market share. The Fed is worried about inflation. (Note: 'Fed' implies sentient beings who comprise the group) The opinion polls don't seem to worry the President. His mother's dizzy spells have worried John.

sense.name: repeatedly handle or manipulate something physically
sense.examples: Don't worry that tooth loose. The old man worried his beads, while the dog worried his bone.
